CatDescriptText: Mr. Samuel Lewis, retired railroader, Crafton and Mr. Cleveland Clark, retired, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 23, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think race relations are improving or worsening in Pittsburgh?" Mr. Samuel Lewis' answer reads: "They are not improving at Kaufmann's.  Joseph Horne's is putting on many Negroes, as is Gimebis."  Mr. Cleveland Clark's answer reads: I don't think they have improved as much as they should have.  We still have a long way to go."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Samuel Lewis wearing fedora, eyeglasses, diagonally striped tie with tie bar, standing near Thrift Drugs, corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, Downtown; Portrait of Cleveland Clark, wearing fedora, dark knit tie, and dark coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
